qas.question: What two epic narratives were written by Homer?

The two great ancient Greek historians were?

Modern Greek genres include philosophy, poetry, and what other three genres?

plausible_answers.text: philosophical texts that are the foundation of Western philosophy,

qas.question: The three Roman authors whose plays still exist are who?
Which playwright  provided the only real examples of the genre of New Comedy?
What two epics did Homer write in ancient Rome?
Who wrote Works end Days and Theology?
What types of texts did Plato and Socrates author?
Who were two early Roman historians?
Whose plays give examples of New Comedy?
Who wrote both the Iliad and Theogony?
What type of texts did Plato and Sappho author that were so important to the West?
What Westerners were influential lyric poets?
What still exists written by Aeschylus, Sophocles, and Plato?

context: In ancient Greece, the epics of <b15_0>Homer<b15_0/>, who wrote <a0_0><b5_0><b10_0>the Iliad and the Odyssey<b10_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, and <a1_0><b11_0>Hesiod<b11_0/><a1_0/>, who wrote Works and Days and Theogony, are some of the earliest, and most influential, of Ancient Greek literature. Classical Greek genres included philosophy, poetry, <b6_0>historiography, comedies and dramas.<b6_0/> Plato and Aristotle authored <a2_0><b7_0><b12_0><b16_0>philosophical texts<b16_0/><b12_0/><a2_0/> that are the foundation of Western philosophy,<b7_0/> <a3_0><b17_0>Sappho and Pindar<b17_0/><a3_0/> were influential lyric poets, and <a4_0><b13_0>Herodotus and Thucydides<b13_0/><a4_0/> were early Greek historians. Although drama was popular in Ancient Greece, of the hundreds of tragedies written and performed during the classical age, only a limited number of <b18_0>plays<b18_0/> by three authors still exist: <b8_0>Aeschylus, Sophocles, and Euripides.<b8_0/> The plays of <b9_0><b14_0>Aristophanes<b14_0/><b9_0/> provide the only real examples of a genre of comic drama known as Old Comedy, the earliest form of Greek Comedy, and are in fact used to define the genre.
